abstract.text: Copies bytes from a given memory block into a block buffer replacing bytes in the underlying data blocks.

This function is used to replace bytes in a
memory blocks with those from a provided piece of memory. It deals with the possibility of the destination range of data being noncontiguous.
() is called on the given
. If desired range is subsequently not accessible in the
, an error is returned and the contents of the
are untouched.

abstract.text: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.
A reference to a block buffer instance.
Accesses potentially noncontiguous data in a block buffer.
Adds a reference to an existing block buffer.
Adds a memory block to an existing block buffer.
Assures that the system allocates memory for all memory blocks in a block buffer.
Copies bytes from a block buffer into a provided memory area.
Fills the destination buffer with the specified data byte.
Copies bytes from a given memory block into a block buffer replacing bytes in the underlying data blocks.
A raw pointer for accessing untyped data.
